net.tinyos.prowler.floodrouting

Class FloodRouting

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.tinyos.prowler.Application
      • net.tinyos.prowler.floodrouting.FloodRouting

  • public class FloodRouting
extends Application
    This is the heart of this package. It demultiplexes the incomming FloodRoutingMsgs, it also has a timer to call the RoutingApplication.age() function periodically in the registered RoutingApplications.
    Be aware that after creating the last RoutingApplication the initialize() has to be called explicitly!!!
    Author:
    Gabor Pap (gabor.pap@vanderbilt.edu)

    • Constructor Detail

      • FloodRouting

        public FloodRouting(Node node)
        Parameterized constructor. Besides calling the parent's constructor it starts a one second timer with a random offset;
        Parameters:
        node - a reference to the Node object on which this Application runs

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize()
        When all the RoutingApplications are created this has to be called. Every RoutingApplication registers itself in a given FloodRouting, stating the maximum number of datapackets needed in a message, so when all of them are created then this method creates only one FloodRoutingMsg with the overall maximum.

      • receiveMessage

        public void receiveMessage(java.lang.Object message,
                  Node sender)
        This demultiplexes the incomming messages to the appropriate routing application. This function also triggers a new message sending.
        Overrides:
        receiveMessage in class Application
        Parameters:
        message - The message that arrived.
        sender - The sender node of the last message.

      • sendMessageDone

        public void sendMessageDone()
        Signals the sendDone event to the appropriate routing application.
        Overrides:
        sendMessageDone in class Application
        See Also:
        Application.sendMessage(java.lang.Object)

      • sendMsg

        public void sendMsg()
        This function selects a ready to send routing application and sends a message full of its data packets. If a routing application has a data packet, it has to call this function!

      • getRoutingApplication

        public RoutingApplication getRoutingApplication(java.lang.Class appClass)
        Returns the routing application whose class is identical with the parameter. WARNING! We asume that there is only one RoutingApplication Object per RoutingApplication subclass.
        Parameters:
        appClass - the type of application we are looking for
        Returns:
        returns the routing application instance or null if not found

      • removeRoutingApplication

        public void removeRoutingApplication(java.lang.Class appClass)
        Removes the routing application whose class is identical with the parameter. WARNING! We asume that there is only one RoutingApplication Object per RoutingApplication subclass.
        Parameters:
        appClass - the type of application we are looking for

        Adds or we can also say wires a routing application to the mote's routing application framework.
        Parameters:
